item.title: Networks
item.description: Here is the stuff I read related to networks, different models and their working, OSI Model The OSI Model (Open Systems Interconnection Model) is a conceptual framework used to describe the functions of a networking system. It defines rules and requirements that support effortless data transfer between different products and software. In the OSI reference model, the communications between a computing system are split into seven different abstraction layers: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, and Application.
